title: "q63 'How many milligrams of cannabis do you use per week?' (Veterans)"
author: "David Ritter"

output: html_document
runtime: shiny
---

```{r, message = FALSE}
# Load libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(stringr)
source("helper.R")
```

```{r}
# Read in raw data from the Veterans surveys. These are the files downloaded from survey monkey saved as a .csv
raw_data_general <- read.csv("data/general.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
raw_data_botanist <- read.csv("data/botanist.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
raw_data_bask <- read.csv("data/bask.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
raw_data_hr <- read.csv("data/hr.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
```

```{r}
# Pull out all responses for q63 (a choose all question), combine, turn into a tidy data format for further processing then determine 'question n'
q63 <- 'How.many.milligrams.of.cannabis.do.you.use.per.week.'
q63_final_response <- "X.297"

q63_general <- get_single_selection(data = raw_data_general, q.name = q63)
q63_botanist <- get_single_selection(data = raw_data_botanist, q.name = q63)
q63_bask <- get_single_selection(data = raw_data_bask, q.name = q63)
q63_hr <- get_single_selection(data = raw_data_hr, q.name = q63)

q63_all <- rbind(q63_general, q63_botanist, q63_bask, q63_hr)

q63_n <- length(unique(q63_all$id))
```

```{r}
# Manipulate data into a graphable format
q63_plot <-
  q63_all %>%
  group_by(chosen) %>%
  summarize(count = n()) %>%
  mutate(percent_all = count / sum(count)) %>%
  mutate(percent_responded = count / q63_n)
```

```{r}
# Plot with percents and response counts
r <- 
  ggplot(q63_plot, aes(x = reorder(chosen, count), y = percent_responded)) +
  geom_bar(stat = 'identity') +
  coord_flip() +
  geom_text(aes(label= paste(round(percent_responded,2), count, sep = "***")))

r
```

```{r}
# Save graph as PNG, plot data as csv, and all question data including response IDs as csv (save question n and N at end of plot file as "_x.x")
ggsave(filename = 'q63_mg_cannabis.png', plot = r, device = 'png')

write.csv(q63_plot, 'q63_mg_cannabis_4.csv', row.names = FALSE)

write.csv(q63_all, 'q63_mg_cannabis_ids.csv', row.names = FALSE)
```
